Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
🚀 Are you the NEX T Data Scientist? 🚀


O que valorizamos:

  • Formação em Engenharia Informática, Matemática, Estatística ou áreas similares;
  • Experiência sólida em R, Python e SQL;
  • Conhecimento aplicado em Inteligência Artificial e Machine Learning;
  • Experiência com ETL, bases de dados SQL/NoSQL;
  • Domínio de Power BI, bibliotecas de visualização em Python (Matplotlib, Seaborn, Plotly) e SSRS;
  • Experiência em extração de dados via APIs;
  • Pensamento crítico, curiosidade, e fortes competências de comunicação para traduzir dados em insights claros;
  • Capacidade de gestão de tempo, trabalho em equipa e foco na resolução de problemas.


O que podes esperar desta função:

📍 Lisboa

💻 Híbrido

  • Desenvolvimento de modelos preditivos e soluções baseadas em IA;
  • Criação de dashboards, visualizações e relatórios acionáveis;
  • Manipulação e engenharia de dados para suportar iniciativas analíticas;
  • Colaboração com equipas multidisciplinares para alavancar decisões orientadas por dados;
  • Participação em projetos de transformação digital e automação de processos.


O que te proporcionamos:

  • Equipa dinâmica e profissional;
  • Possibilidade de participação em projetos locais ou internacionais;
  • Acompanhamento personalizado;
  • Plano de Formação adequado às tuas necessidades;
  • Orientação para a progressão e desenvolvimento de carreira;
  • Oportunidade para fazer parte de uma equipa em grande crescimento.


Pronto para o desafio? Junta-te à NEX T e ajuda-nos a transformar dados em decisões estratégicas! 💡


Partilha o teu CV para your@nextengineering.pt com a REFª AOL.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist - Global Consulting Partner - Madrid




Tech stack: Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist




Our client, one of the most known consultancy companies in the world is looking to expand their Data & Analytics team, bringing some professionals that want to work with the best clients in th emarket.




Our client is looking for talented, enthusiastic and passionate Data Scientists (Data Scientist Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes, Data Scientist) to bring their services to the market and help enhance this already successful company!




Successful Data Scientists candidates should be able to demonstrate strong knowledge of: Python/R/Java/C++, Cloud Azure AWS, Git/GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, SQL, Cloud, Docker, Kubernetes




Training will be provided in any of the technologies you lack, allowing you to turn your technological weaknesses into your greatest strengths!




All Data Scientists positions come with the following benefits:




25 days holiday (plus Public Holidays)
REAL flexibility on how and when you work
Allowance for trainings/certifications/conferences
Insurance
Private medical




Location: Madrid, Spain / Hybrid Working




Salary: 49k for Seniors and above 50k for managers (with 20% bonus)




InterEx Group are Experts in Data, ERP and CRM, we are committed to supporting your career progression!

Title: Data Scientist/ Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You will be crucial in supporting our business by creating valuable, actionable insights about the data, and communicating your findings to the business.  You will work with various stakeholders to determine how to use business data for business solutions/insights.

How You Will Contribute

You will:


Analyze and derive value from data through the application methods such as statistics, time series modelling, machine learning and data visualization. 
Determine, create and maintain the best time series / machine learning models be to be used, by considering SKU demand behavior using segmentation strategy, to generate high quality demand statistical forecast with low forecast error and bias
Collaborate with Demand Planners to identify right drivers and understand business challenges, create valuable actionable insights about the data, and communicate your findings to the business. 
Develop data hypotheses and methods, train and evaluate forecasting models, share insights and findings, and continue to iterate with additional data.



What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:


Experience in application of ML concepts and methodologies (especially time series modeling, but also regression, classification, feature engineering and selection etc.)
Knowledge/experience with statistical programming languages including SAS, SQL, etc., to process data and gain insights from it
Good communication skills to promote cross-team collaboration
Strong analytical and presentation skills
Advanced English



Education / Experience


Student of or a degree in quantitative field of Big data, Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science or similar
Certificates of SAS Base, SAS Viya, etc, will be an advantage
Experience on working with FMCG, Food & Beverages, Retail or similar industry data with understanding the business process with be advantage



What We Offer


Exciting work in a multi-cultural team of bright minds
Flexible remote work options, or – if you prefer – access to a modern office
Opportunity to learn new technologies such as Python, pySpark, AWS
Opportunities to develop further in our Data Science community as well as in the international organization
All kinds of benefits depending on the location



Relocation Support Available?

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our succes

Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Excited to grow your career?

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist
Description:
Deine Aufgaben


Als Teil unseres AI & Data Science Teams entwickelst du datengetriebene Lösungen für Herausforderungen unserer Kunden im Bereich Sales und Marketing.
Mit deinem Fachwissen und Business-Verständnis unterstützt du bei der Übersetzung von Kundenanforderungen in konkrete Konzepte.
Du bist insbesondere an der operativen Umsetzung beteiligt und durchläufst den gesamten Prozess von der Datenaufbereitung bis zur Analyse und Ergebnispräsentation.
Unser AI & Data Science Team übernimmt eine Vielzahl von Aufgaben – gemeinsam finden wir den optimalen Mix für Dich:
Untersuchen und Aufbereiten von Daten für Prozesse und Analysen
Deskriptive Analysen und Visualisierungen
Gewinnung von Insights durch Experimente und statistische Datenanalysen
Aufbau von supervised und unsupervised Machine Learning Modellen
Einsatz von AI und NLP zur Entwicklung innovativer Lösungsansätze
Konzeption, Entwicklung und Implementierung von Data Science Services

Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Data Science, Informatik, VWL oder einem anderen quantitativ-analytischen Fach.
Erfahrung mit Analysemethoden aus Statistik, Ökonometrie, Machine Learning, NLP oder Deep Learning.
Gute Coding-Fähigkeiten in Python, insbesondere zur Datenaufbereitung, mit mindestens einem Jahr praktischer Erfahrung.
Kenntnisse in SQL, R, Git, Crawling oder allgemeine Programmiererfahrung sind ein Plus.
Du brennst für Data Science und hast eine hohe Affinität zu Zahlen und Daten, möchtest aber durch deine Analysen auch aktiv den Business-Erfolg beeinflussen.
Du hast einen hohen Qualitätsanspruch an deine Arbeit und stellst dies durch effektive Teststrategien sicher.
Du bist eine Lösungsfinderin / ein Lösungsfinder für die Herausforderungen unserer Kund:innen mit einem ausgeprägten Maß an Proaktivität, Selbstständigkeit und Organisationsfähigkeit.
Teamplay ist für dich selbstverständlich und du überzeugst unsere Kund:innen bei Bedarf auch vor Ort.
Deutsch und Englisch mindestens auf C1-Niveau.


Dein Extra


Großartiger Teamspirit und spannende Aufgaben in einem innovativen Zukunftsmarkt mit einer Kultur der Verantwortung, Offenheit und Zusammenarbeit.
Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home-Office-Tage, „Work from Anywhere“ in Europa, kostenloses Massage- und Physioangebot, Activity-Raum mit Kicker, regelmäßige Team-Events.
Leckerer Kaffee aus einer professionellen Siebträgermaschine und andere Getränke
Aktuelle Hard- und Software sowie Arbeit mit vielfältigen Daten aus verschiedenen Phasen des Data Lifecycles.
Raum zur Mitgestaltung: Deine Ideen und Erfahrungen fließen direkt in die Weiterentwicklung unseres Teams ein.
Zentrale Lage und moderne Büros direkt am Gänsemarkt, verkehrsgünstig zu erreichen.
Intensive Begleitung im Rahmen des DATALOGUE Entwicklungsprogramms gepaart mit einer offenen Feedbackkultur über alle Ebenen, durch die du gezielt in deiner persönlichen Entwicklung unterstützt wirst.
Kooperationen mit Urban Sports Club, Fitness First, Jobrad sowie weiteren Partnern – für deine Gesundheit und dein Wohlbefinden.


Über uns

Data Monetization by Customer Relevance: Dafür steht DATALOGUE. Daten bilden bei uns den Grundstein für alle unsere Projekte – sie sind unsere Leidenschaft und unser täglicher Antrieb. Wir bei DATALOGUE unterstützen unsere Kunden, relevante Insights aus Daten zu generieren und nutzen Data Intelligence, um die Customer Experience im gesamten Kundenlebenszyklus zu optimieren – für bessere Leadgewinnung, optimale Kundenbindung, effizienteres Marketing und mehr Ertrag für unsere Kunden. An unseren nationalen und internationalen Standorten in Hamburg, Zürich und Amsterdam betreut ein Expertenteam etablierte Marken aus den Bereichen Finanz- und Versicherungswirtschaft, Touristik, Bildung, Entertainment und Telekommunikation sowie aus der Energie- und der Konsumgüterbranche – darunter die Freenet Group, die Hamburger Sparkasse, Metro, A-ROSA oder der Schweizer Augenoptik-Experte Visilab.

Mit der Relevance Group schaffen wir die Basis für mehr Business Impact und nachhaltiger Customer Relevance: Werde jetzt ein Teil unserer spannenden Reise!

Data Monetization by Customer Relevance: Dafür steht DATALOGUE. Daten bilden bei uns den Grundstein für alle unsere Projekte – sie sind unsere Leidenschaft und unser täglicher Antrieb. Wir bei DATALOGUE unterstützen unsere Kunden, relevante Insights aus Daten zu generieren und nutzen Data Intelligence, um die Customer Experience im gesamten Kundenlebenszyklus zu optimieren – für bessere Leadgewinnung, optimale Kundenbindung, effizienteres Marketing und mehr Ertrag für unsere Kunden. An unseren nationalen und internationalen Standorten in Hamburg, Zürich und Amsterdam betreut ein Expertenteam etablierte Marken aus den Bereichen Finanz- und Versicherungswirtschaft, Touristik, Bildung, Entertainment und Telekommunikation sowie aus der Energie- und der Konsumgüterbranche – darunter die Freenet Group, die Hamburger Sparkasse, Metro, A-ROSA oder der Schweizer Augenoptik-Experte Visilab.

Mit der Relevance Group schaffen wir die Basis für mehr Business Impact und nachhaltiger Customer Relevance: Werde jetzt ein Teil unserer spannenden Reise!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior AI/ML Engineer – LLM & Production Systems




Location: Berlin (Hybrid) | Type: Full-time




Join us at the cutting edge of Conversational Ai. We're building enterprise-scale AI systems that power real-time, multilingual conversations between brands and customers. If you're passionate about LLMs, production-grade ML systems, and creating tangible product impact—this is the role for you.




What You’ll Do

Design and scale AI systems that are production-ready, resilient, and built for enterprise use
Build and optimise real-time LLM inference pipelines to support high-volume, low-latency environments
Own full-stack ML responsibilities, from training to deployment, monitoring, and optimisation
Develop intelligent search systems using vector databases and embedding pipelines
Drive multilingual AI capabilities for a global customer base
Collaborate across teams to bring cutting-edge AI capabilities into live product experiences
Leverage modern infrastructure, from PyTorch and Weaviate to Gemini and cloud-native ML stacks




What You Bring

An advanced degree (Master’s or PhD) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, or a related field
3–5 years of hands-on experience delivering ML/AI systems into production
Deep knowledge of LLMs, RAG, and model evaluation methodologies
Expertise in Python, along with ML frameworks like PyTorch or PyTorch Lightning
Experience with cloud-based ML tooling (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Strong debugging skills—comfortable diagnosing model drift, performance issues, and data anomalies
Familiarity with MLOps/LLMOps best practices, including CI/CD, observability, and pipeline automation
A builder’s mindset—curious, driven, and motivated by shipping AI that solves real problems




Why You’ll Love It Her

Work on real-world AI challenges that impact thousands of global users
Use cutting-edge tools like Weaviate, Gemini, and PyTorch
Shape the direction of our AI roadmap with real ownership and influence
Be part of a culture that values innovation, collaboration, and celebrating wins—big and small
Enjoy competitive compensation, virtual stock options (VSOP), and a vibrant office in central Berlin
Thrive in a startup environment with flexibility, autonomy, and purpose

Show more

Title: Data Scientist (H/F)
Description:
Pourquoi a-t-on besoin de vous ?

Vous rejoindrez l’équipe « AI & Data Analytics », intégrée au département «Data & Analytics» dans l’organisation « Global Digital & IT». «Data & Analytics» regroupe les activités suivantes : Data Engineering, Data Capture & Delivery, BI & Visualization, Platform & Architecture, Data Governance and Data Engagement.




Au sein de l’équipe Data Science, sous la responsabilité du Head of AI & Data Analytics, vous aurez le rôle de Data Scientist.

En tant que tel, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes :

Participer aux études et cadrages des projets client et construire une stratégie pour les produits AI développés dans le département;
Mener des projets exploratoires faisant appel à des techniques avancées de Data Science (NLP, deep learning, Generative AI, apprentissage par renforcement ou par transfert), de façon autonome ou avec des partenaires externes ;
Assurer une veille technologique permanente sur ces sujets ;
Participer à l’industrialisation des algorithmes en lien avec les équipes engineering basée sur MLOps;
Accompagner les équipes opérationnelles dans le déploiement des algorithmes, notamment sur le volet analytics ;
Mener des ateliers d’idéation avec les équipes métiers (industrie, marketing, ventes, logistique, e-commerce, finance, RH) pour identifier les opportunités d’exploitation de la donnée et diffuser la culture data/IA au sein de l’entreprise.




Ce poste est-il fait pour vous ?

En complément des missions évoquées, une réelle appétence pour la gestion et la facilitation de projet, avec une certaine aisance en termes de communication, seraient fortement appréciées.

Notre équipe ayant vocation à travailler pour des clients internes pouvant être basés en France comme à l’étranger, la maitrise de l’anglais (écrite et orale) est obligatoire.




Ingénieur diplômé d’une école généraliste (Centrale, X, Mines, ENS etc.)
Grande connaissance du Machine Learning, des statistiques et des probabilités.
SQL et Python, packages de ML: scikit, xgboost, keras
Expérience de travail sur un cloud provider et savoir construire des data pipelines serait un plus
Gestion de code : Git, Gitlab, CI/CD
Maitriser la modélisation à la fois prédictive et descriptive
Savoir implémenter des dashboards et autres outils de data viz
Posséder de bonnes qualités de communication : vous pouvez expliquer vos modèles clairement à la fois à des data analysts mais aussi à des Directeurs Généraux ou des responsables opérationnels.
Etre organisé, structuré et motivé par l’innovation
Aimer le travail en équipe et savoir apprendre de chacun.
Un état d’esprit orienté business et apport de valeur pour les équipes métiers







Si vous recherchez des défis passionnants, pouvant impacter des centaines de milliers de clients, et aimez travailler avec des outils à la pointe de la technologie, venez et rejoignez-nous !

Vous participerez donc à la montée en puissance de l’équipe créée récemment, tout en intervenant sur un ou plusieurs cas d’utilisation.




Début : Dès que vous êtes prêts
Localisation : La Tour Saint-Gobain, La Défense

Show more

Title: Data Scientist internship
Description:
Our Exciting Opportunity

Within Cognitive Software Engineering, you will be working with groundbreaking technology (5G, Automation & Cloud computing) to leverage the power of AI/ML and to develop state of the art software for network design and optimization services.

As part of our commitment to nurturing future talent, we are offering an exciting opportunity for a Data Scientist Intern to join our organization.

You will work closely with our experienced data science team to review and integrate AI models and algorithms. You will gain hands-on experience in data analysis, machine learning, and AI techniques, while contributing to the development of cutting-edge software solutions.

This internship will provide valuable exposure to real-world projects and an opportunity to learn from industry experts.

You will:


Collaborate with the data science team & software engineers to analyze and understand project requirements and objectives.
Lead the integration of AI models into software applications and ensure their proper functionality.
Oversee the lifecycle management of AI models, including deployment, monitoring, updating, and retraining strategies to ensure sustained performance and relevance.
Conduct exploratory data analysis, data preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for modeling tasks.
Review and experiment with different machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms.
Train, validate, and fine-tune machine learning models using relevant programming languages and frameworks.
Evaluate and interpret the performance of AI models using appropriate evaluation metrics and statistical methods for various software projects.
Document and present findings, insights, and recommendations to the data science team and project stakeholders.
Stay updated with the latest advancements and best practices in AI, machine learning, and data science techniques.
Contribute to team discussions, brainstorming sessions, and knowledge sharing activities to foster a collaborative learning environment.


To be successful in the role you must have:


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Solid understanding of fundamental concepts in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analysis.
Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in data science, such as Python.
Familiarity with popular machine learning frameworks and libraries, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn.
Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and exploratory data analysis techniques.
Knowledge of statistical methods, hypothesis testing, and experimental design.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
Good communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with team members spread across the globe.
Fluent English is a must, written and spoken
Self-motivated and eager to learn, with a passion for AI, machine learning, and data science.
Previous experience or coursework in AI, machine learning, or data science is a plus.


What´s in it for you?

Here at Ericsson, our culture is built on over a century of courageous decisions. With us, you will no longer be dreaming of what the future holds – you will be redefining it. You won’t develop for the status quo but will build what replaces it. Joining us is a way to move your career in any direction you want; with hundreds of career opportunities in locations all over the world, in a place where co-creation and collaboration are embedded into the walls. You will find yourself in a speak-up environment where empathy and humanness serve as cornerstones for how we work, and where work-life balance is a priority. Welcome to an inclusive, global company where your opportunity to make an impact is endless.

For this position, we offer a balanced remote-presential work environment, and the position is based in our R&D branch in Málaga, Spain.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Ready to find your perfect job fit?

Welcome to HomeBuddy, where making a home awesome is like seeing a vision come to life! We are on a mission to create a friendly and trusted platform to connect homeowners with the right contractors across the US.

What started as a small idea has become a fast-growing home improvement platform focusing on lead quality and long-term partnerships based on trust and mutual success. We are a product-first company with a long-term outlook - our platform consistently and positively evolves based on data insights and the most up-to-date tools.

This job is for you if


You would like to work in a positive atmosphere where teamwork and trust in your colleagues are primary values.
You succeed in an environment that values initiative and sharing feedback and where your suggestions and efforts are recognized and appreciated
You are used to taking responsibility for solving difficult tasks and are directly involved in how your efforts impact the final result



This role is full-time and offers home working flexibility.

Your future tasks will include


Developing and implementing machine learning models to refine lead scoring, identify customer segments, maximize conversions, optimize advertising bids, and prevent churn
Utilize geospatial and socioeconomic data to build predictive models that identify high-value audiences, leaving the competition in our dust
Design and implement pricing & distribution optimization algorithms that maximize lead conversion rates and minimize customer acquisition costs, ensuring we're always in the black
Collaborate seamlessly with marketing, sales, and product teams, translating data-driven insights into actionable campaigns
Present data findings with clarity, conciseness, and a dash of statistical humor, leaving stakeholders nodding in agreement



You're going to need this to be successful in this role


Master's Degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics, Quantitative Methods or a Related Field
5+ years of experience in the data domain with +2 in data science roles
Expertise in SQL, Python, and Machine Learning frameworks (especially supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms)
Proven experience deploying machine learning models to production environments using tools and frameworks like ML Flow & AWS Sagemaker, ensuring our models are always ready for prime time
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail
Impeccable communication and presentation skills, capable of translating data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth without losing the audience in a sea of jargon
A demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team, ensuring we're always scoring the highest in teamwork
Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable business strategies that drive revenue growth, making us a data-driven powerhouse
Fluent English



It's nice if you also have


Up-to-date with the latest data science techniques, whitepapers, and best practices
We value working on Kaggle projects, so if you have a passion for machine learning and are an active Kaggle contributor, please highlight this in your application



Why choose HomeBuddy


Enjoy the freedom to work from anywhere without being tied to one place - while ensuring you are available to our team during the agreed working hours
Achieve a harmonious work-life balance with a flexible schedule tailored to your local needs, along with paid vacation, sick leave, and local holidays
Empower yourself with work equipment of your choice partially paid for by HomeBuddy and up-to-date apps and tools to maximize your productivity
Feel valued and appreciated with an industry-leading compensation package
Get recognized and rewarded for both outstanding individual efforts leading to extraordinary results and our team success.
Enhance your well-being with our allowance program covering fitness activities and mental health programs
Learn and expand your knowledge by both working on complex tasks and using paid training opportunities, including courses, events, and conferences



If this sounds like you, we should talk!

Privacy Policy

By sending us your application you agree that Siren Group AG (known as HomeBuddy) will process your personal data to participate in this recruitment process. If you want to know more about how Siren Group AG processes your personal data please click here.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Scientist




What’s more meaningful than seeing the real-world impact of your work?




Ok, maybe ending world hunger, but this is a strong second.

At OOONO, you’re not just building models in a notebook. You’re shaping the algorithms that directly power a physical product - used in real time by real people in the real world.

Join a small, collaborative team where you’re trusted to take ownership, test bold ideas, and push things into production. You’ll work hands-on with rich geospatial data to make our location logic smarter and faster.

And you’ll do it side by side with engineers, hardware specialists, and designers who genuinely care - about the product, the users, and each other.

What you’ll be doing

Develop and improve core algorithms to enhance product performance and user experience.
Contribute to map matching logic and road network analysis to improve location accuracy
Design, build, and maintain predictive models to solve complex business challenges.
Analyze large-scale data sets from Athena, MongoDB, and other sources to extract actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Software, Hardware, UX/UI) to implement data-driven solutions.
Experiment with cutting-edge geospatial tools and frameworks to continuously improve analytical workflows.
Handle location data and geo spatial field.




We imagine you’re someone who has

A master’s degree in data science, geoinformatics or similar field
Proven experience (3+ years) in a Data Science role or similar, ideally within a tech environment and working with geospatial data
Proficiency in Python, including libraries such as Polars, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, and geospatial libraries like GeoPandas, Shapely, Pyproj, Folium, Osmnx
Knowledge of geospatial analysis techniques (e.g., spatial joins, indexing, projections).
Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and algorithm development.
Solid problem-solving skills and ability to work independently when needed
Hands-on person that can drive processes from A to B independently
English is a requirement.
Self-driven




How is it working at OOONO?

We’re glad we asked. It’s a nice working place. As in nice-nice. We have a relaxed, informal atmosphere and a flat hierarchy. Whenever you need a break from your important work stuff, you can get beat in table tennis, foosball, or just smalltalk about the weather by the coffee machine. We have monthly social events where we do anything from go-karting to going to festivals.

And when we’re not social? Then we’re pretty damn ambitious. We don’t like conservative targets or linear growth. We’re all about the extraordinary. This has led OOONO to become one of the fastest-growing tech scaleups and surprise-surprise: We have no plans of slowing down. So yes, OOONO is a lovely place to work, but it’s also a pretty good opportunity to develop as a person and take the next steps in your career.




The practical stuff

Start date: ASAP
Send your motivated CV to job@ooono.dk
Working hours: Full-time (37 hours)
Location: Gearhalsvej 1.1, 2500 Valby




Please note: To be considered for this position, you must be currently living in Denmark.

Show more

  • English is a requirement.
  • Self-driven


How is it working at OOONO?

We’re glad we asked. It’s a nice working place. As in nice-nice. We have a relaxed, informal atmosphere and a flat hierarchy. Whenever you need a break from your important work stuff, you can get beat in table tennis, foosball, or just smalltalk about the weather by the coffee machine. We have monthly social events where we do anything from go-karting to going to festivals.

And when we’re not social? Then we’re pretty damn ambitious. We don’t like conservative targets or linear growth. We’re all about the extraordinary. This has led OOONO to become one of the fastest-growing tech scaleups and surprise-surprise: We have no plans of slowing down. So yes, OOONO is a lovely place to work, but it’s also a pretty good opportunity to develop as a person and take the next steps in your career.


The practical stuff

  • Start date: ASAP
  • Send your motivated CV to job@ooono.dk
  • Working hours: Full-time (37 hours)
  • Location: Gearhalsvej 1.1, 2500 Valby


Please note: To be considered for this position, you must be currently living in Denmark.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Hola! 🙋

¿Todavía no conoces HIBERUS TECNOLOGÍA? Somos una empresa de #tecnología construida con un ingrediente diferencial, la HIPERESPECIALIZACIÓN.

Formar parte de Hiberus significa crecimiento, pasión por la tecnología, interés por la innovación, ambiente laboral flexible y colaborativo, compañerismo, aprendizaje, formación continua, motivación y superación ante nuevos retos...y esto es solo el principio.

Somos más de 3.000 profesionales y no paramos de crecer!🙌

Actualmente contamos con más de 36 hubs de desarrollo en España, EEUU, Reino Unido, Alemania, Rumanía, Italia, Andorra, Marruecos, Argentina, México, Ecuador y Colombia ¡Estamos redefiniendo el mapa tecnológico mundial! 🌐 💻

Trabajamos muy duro, para transformar nuestra vida a través de la tecnología y queremos contar contigo para seguir creciendo. Si lo tuyo es el mundo IT, te gusta estar al día en las últimas tecnologías y quieres asumir un nuevo reto profesional ¡Sigue leyendo, te estamos buscando!

🔎¿Qué estamos buscando?

Buscamos un/a Data Scientist ubicado/a en Madrid con más de 2 años de experiencia que quieran incorporarse al equipo y ser parte de un proyecto líder en el sector de los medios de comunicación. Será responsable de desarrollar modelos de machine learning, analizar grandes volúmenes de datos, crear dashboards y visualizaciones efectivas, y generar insights que contribuyan a la toma de decisiones estratégicas. Trabajará en estrecha colaboración con equipos de negocio, ingeniería y producto para diseñar soluciones basadas en datos que mejoren nuestros productos y servicios.

🖋️ Requisitos

Conocimientos avanzados en Python y experiencia en el manejo de entornos de big data, especialmente con PySpark, así como bases de datos SQL.
Experiencia en entornos cloud, preferiblemente en Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Experiencia en técnicas de NLP, incluyendo procesamiento y análisis de texto, extracción de entidades, modelado de tópicos y clasificación de documentos.
Conocimientos en visualización de datos con Tableau.
Habilidades de comunicación para presentar resultados a equipos no técnicos.
Nivel B2 de inglés




💻Funciones

Diseñar, desarrollar y evaluar modelos de machine learning y analítica avanzada.
Extraer, limpiar y transformar datos de diversas fuentes para su análisis.
Implementar y optimizar algoritmos en entornos productivos.
Colaborar con equipos multidisciplinarios para traducir necesidades de negocio en soluciones basadas en datos.
Generar informes y visualizaciones que faciliten la interpretación de los resultados.
Aplicar técnicas de NLP para el análisis de contenidos y tendencias.
Documentar metodologías y resultados para su reutilización y escalabilidad.




🙌¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Contrato indefinido en una compañía puramente tecnológica, que forma parte de un gran grupo, solvente y en crecimiento.

💰 Salario fijo competitivo + bonificación

🏖️ Ambiente familiar, cercano, ¡como una gran familia!

⏰ Conciliación con nuestra vida personal y laboral mediante horario flexible, acuerdos de teletrabajo, desconexión digital, jornada intensiva viernes y verano.

🤙 Cultura “techie”, nos gusta estar en contacto con la tecnología, herramientas, y últimas novedades!

📚 ¡Formación! Siempre que quieras, disfrutarás de un amplio catálogo de cursos formativos, adaptados a tu perfil profesional, inquietudes y novedades del sector. Para ello, pondremos a tu disposición todo el potencial de nuestra Hiberus University y los acuerdos con los principales fabricantes.

💳 ¡Benefíciate! Programa de retribución flexible a medida: seguro médico, tarjeta de transporte público, cheques guardería, tarjeta restaurante, etc.

En Hiberus estamos viviendo un crecimiento explosivo 💥 y queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo.

Suena bien, ¿verdad? Si quieres saber más, ¡inscríbete y te contamos!

Si quieres saber más busca nuestros hashtag #somoshiberus #lascosasocurrenaquí y conoce todo lo que hacemos.

Hablamos?

www.hiberus.com

#somosHiberus y tú? Te animas?🚀

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer | Mid-Senior | Threat Intelligence
HTML:
Our Threat Intelligence team is dedicated to providing accurate and timely information on potential threats to our products. Our team of skilled professionals from various fields, including Data Science, Malware Research, Development, and Privacy, are focused on achieving a common goal by utilizing feeds, heuristics, algorithms, and machine learning.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design & implement machine learning models in production;
  • Create infrastructure for data ingestion, cleaning, and transformation;
  • Ensure scalability, reliability, and performance of deployed models & infrastructure;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning solutions into products and services;
  • Document model development processes, experiments, and results for future reference and reproducibility




Core Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field or equivalent work experience;
  • 2+ years of experience working as Machine Learning Engineer;
  • Proven experience in Data Engineering, Software Development, DevOps, Machine Learning or a related field;
  • Strong understanding and proficiency in Python programming language;
  • Proven track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments with containerization and orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, etc.;
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, HuggingFace, etc.;
  • Experience with AWS services - RDS, Lambda, EC2, S3, EMR, SageMaker, etc.;
  • Experience with version control systems and CI/CD pipelines;
  • Experience developing scalable APIs;
  • Familiarity with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, etc.;
  • Good understanding of Computer Science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures, distributed computing, operating systems);
  • Understanding of Machine Learning fundamentals;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex problems, troubleshoot issues, and develop practical solutions;
  • Ability to communicate problems and solutions with people from different technical backgrounds;
  • Attention to detail, and ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English




Salary Range

  • Gross Salary 17600 - 29900 PLN/Month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.
NordVPN is the world’s most advanced VPN service provider, used by millions of internet users worldwide. NordVPN provides double VPN encryption and Onion Over VPN and guarantees privacy with zero tracking. One of the key features of the product is Threat Protection, which blocks malicious websites, malware, trackers, and ads. NordVPN is very user friendly, offers one of the best prices on the market, and has over 5,000 servers in 59 countries worldwide.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand, at no charge;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, sports access card, online workouts, consultations, programs to improve mental health to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist / Hybrid Amsterdam / 7 months / Start ASAP




Required Skills & Experience:




- Master's degree or PhD in Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field

- 3+ years of experience applying optimization techniques to supply chain or retail problems

- Demonstrated ability to translate business requirements into mathematical models

- Strong knowledge of linear programming, integer programming, and constraint satisfaction

- Proficiency in Python and optimization libraries (e.g., CPLEX, Gurobi, OR-Tools)

- Experience with data manipulation and analysis using SQL and Python




Preferred Qualifications:




- Experience in retail or supply chain management

- Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application to optimization problems

- Background in developing production-grade optimization systems

- Familiarity with cloud-based deployment of optimization solutions




What 3 things from above are most important?

Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving Skills - Demonstrated ability to formulate complex business problems as mathematical models and select appropriate optimization techniques to solve them efficiently.

- Production-Level Programming Experience - Proven track record of implementing optimization algorithms in production environments, with proficiency in translating mathematical models into robust, scalable code.

- Business Acumen in Retail/Supply Chain - Strong understanding of retail operations and supply chain dynamics, with the ability to connect optimization solutions to measurable business outcomes.

Title: DATA SCIENTIST
Description:
Excellence è un gruppo multi-boutique formato da più società con diversa specializzazione: dalla Consulenza Strategica, al ridisegno dei modelli operativi, e al Change Management, fino a coprire temi più innovativi come la Digital Disruption oppure la transizione dei modelli di business in chiave ESG.

Il Gruppo è stato fondato nel 2007 e rappresenta uno dei più significativi casi di successo di start-up che in breve tempo è riuscita a crescere ed affermarsi nel settore dei professional services.




Dataskills opera a 360° nel settore della Data Science, aiutando ad estrarre valore dal patrimonio di dati aziendale. Leader italiano in questo campo, ricerca e sviluppa negli ambiti di Business Intelligence, Big Data Analytics, Analisi Predittiva, Artificial Intelligence, e IOT e collabora con le principali aziende dell’industria 4.0.




Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una risorsa brillante da inserire nel ruolo di: DATA SCIENTIST




Cosa farai?

Svilupperai soluzioni avanzate di Predictive Analytics ed AI Generativa progettando modelli di Machine Learning e architetture AI per supportare le decisioni strategiche aziendali;
Riceverai supporto e formazione da esperti del settore per affinare costantemente le tue competenze;
Lavorerai su progetti sfidanti che richiederanno l'applicazione di tecniche di data science all'avanguardia;
Prenderai parte allo sviluppo delle competenze interne all’area DataSkills e contribuirai alla crescita dell’azienda portando idee, spunti individuali e proposte di nuovi progetti e prodotti, seguendone lo sviluppo verso i clienti.




Chi ricerchiamo?

Esperienza di almeno 1 anno in ruoli relativi a Data Analytics, Machine Learning o GenAI;
Passione per i dati e abilità nell’analisi di informazioni complesse;
Capacità di presentazione, comunicazione e sintesi di informazioni tecniche;
Padronanza consolidata di Python, utilizzato come principale strumento di analisi e sviluppo di modelli predittivi;
Solida competenza in SQL, con abilità nel progettare query.
Conoscenza di algoritmi, modelli e principali tecniche di Machine Learning
Ottime doti relazionali, capacità organizzative, proattività ed entusiasmo;
Capacità di leadership, capacità relazionale e predisposizione al lavoro di gruppo;
Conoscenza della lingua inglese al livello B2 o superiore (Riferimento: Common European Framework of Reference for Languages);
Conoscenza della lingua italiana al livello C1 o superiore (Riferimento: CEFR Common European Framework of Reference for Languages).




Gradita, ma non essenziale:

Esperienza nella costruzione di Data Warehouse/Data Lake
Esperienza con Apache Spark ed Azure Databricks




Perché Gruppo Excellence?

Farai parte della nostra crescita

Sarai coinvolto/a in progetti strategici e innovativi per lo sviluppo del business aziendale e potrai lavorare direttamente con il Top Management delle aziende cliente. Chi entrerà a fare parte della nostra squadra troverà un ambiente di lavoro giovane, smart, proattivo e stimolante e avrà la possibilità di lavorare nell’ambito di progetti dinamici per aziende leader nei mercati di riferimento.

Svilupperai il tuo potenziale

Avrai accesso alla nostra piattaforma di formazione Excellence Academy, con un catalogo sempre aggiornato di corsi su hard e soft skills che accresceranno le tue competenze su numerose tematiche. Premiamo il merito e il talento, anche attraverso un percorso di carriera personalizzato: ti daremo la possibilità di realizzare aspirazioni personali in linea con gli obiettivi aziendali.

Siamo un’organizzazione orizzontale in cui la voce di ciascuno viene accolta e valorizzata!

Ci impegniamo a promuovere e a tutelare il valore delle nostre persone, necessarie e fondamentali per lo sviluppo del knowledge aziendale.

Avrai un ottimo work-life balance

Troverai una policy che supporta il lavoro flessibile e la possibilità di lavorare da casa quando necessario. Ti riserviamo un piano welfare per acquisto abbonamenti mezzi pubblici, buoni spesa, corsi, ingressi cinema, abbonamenti palestre, viaggi e molto altro.

Lavorerai in un ambiente inclusivo ed equo

Valorizziamo la diversità, l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutte le nostre persone abbiano pari opportunità lavorative. Il nostro processo di selezione è meritocratico e lontano da qualsivoglia forma di discriminazione diretta o indiretta, nel rispetto dei migliori standard internazionali e delle leggi applicabili (inclusi ma non limitati alla L. 903/77).

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Mavriq, parte di Moltiply Group, è la tech company a cui appartengono alcuni tra i più importanti brand di comparazione ed intermediazione online in Italia (MutuiOnline.it, Segugio.it, SOStariffe.it, Trovaprezzi.it, Switcho e molti altri) e all’estero (LeLynx.fr, Rastreator, Pricewise, Verivox). I servizi offerti dai brand di Mavriq aiutano con trasparenza i consumatori a trovare ciò di cui hanno bisogno, al miglior prezzo. Siamo un team di circa 1.000 “smart disruptors” distribuiti in Europa, America Latina ed Asia.

Il successo di Mavriq è legato al successo dei nostri team. Per questo, siamo oggi alla ricerca di un nuovo o una nuova team member con cui continuare a scrivere la nostra storia nel mondo della comparazione ed intermediazione online a livello internazionale.

Posizione:

Il ruolo

Per supportare la crescita dei progetti di Machine Learning per i brand Segugio.it, PrestitiOnline e altri, siamo alla ricerca di un-a Junior Data Scientist che, riportando alla risorsa Senior del team, supporterà lo sviluppo di algoritmi avanzati per l’ottimizzazione dei nostri processi di acquisizione e di gestione dei clienti.

Location

La tua sede di lavoro sarà in Via Desenzano 2 a Milano (MM1 Gambara). Lavoriamo in modalità ibrida: almeno 2 giorni in ufficio e fino a 3 giorni in smart working, con flessibilità in ingresso e in uscita. I due giorni in ufficio sono un momento per i nostri team di aggregazione e condivisione (di idee, pause pranzo, pause caffè, ecc.), e ci permettono di continuare ad alimentare la nostra Cultura Mavriq.

Come lavoriamo e cosa farai

Il team di Data Scientist, inserito all'interno della Funzione Marketing, si occupa di ideare, implementare e mantenere diversi modelli machine learning a supporto del business.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:


Realizzare progetti complessi di data analisi, con la responsabilità sull’intero ciclo di vita di un “data product”, dall’estrazione e trasformazione del dato fino alla realizzazione e alla messa in produzione dei modelli di machine learning.
Comunicare intuizioni e risultati ricavati dai dati in modo efficace e facilitandone la comprensione ai non addetti ai lavori.
Interagire con analisti ed esperti di business per identificare opportunità innovative.
Collaborare nella creazione di processi data-driven, definendo best-practice per la raccolta e l’uso dei dati.


Requisiti:

Di cosa avrai bisogno per il ruolo


Breve esperienza pregressa in ambito Data Science, specialmente in Machine Learning. Oppure una forte motivazione a costruire il tuo percorso in Data Science.
Buona conoscenza pratica di statistica e machine learning,
Competenza e abilità nell’uso Python e delle sue librerie per Data Science e Machine Learning (Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, ...)
Competenza nell’uso di database relazionali (MySQL, SqlServer, ...),
Familiarità con l’ambiente Linux,
Approccio data-driven alla risoluzione dei problemi,
Capacità di lavorare autonomamente e per obiettivi, bilanciando in maniera efficiente richieste e scadenze,
Capacità di interagire e comunicare efficacemente con interlocutori con profili diversi (manager, business analyst, sviluppatori, ...),
Comprensione dei principali concetti MLOps come deployment e monitoraggio dei modelli,
Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (B2-C1) e italiana (C1).


Cosa troverai da noi


Ambiente di lavoro giovane, dinamico e informale, flessibilità di orario, smartworking, formazione continua e partecipazione a eventi e conferenze.
Sede spaziosa, open space, con diverse sale break e dotata di ciò di cui avrai bisogno per lavorare.
Pacchetto di benefit, come assicurazione sanitaria di base (prevista da CCNL), buoni pasto e welfare.


Non vediamo l’ora di conoscerti!

Altre informazioni:

Puoi scoprire di più su di noi a questo video. Leggere le nostre Recensioni su Indeed o Glassdoor e i nostri post su LinkedIn. Familiarizzare con i nostri principi guida qui.

La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo i sessi (ai sensi delle Leggi n. 903/77 e n. 125/91).

Si richiede esplicito consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (ex D.Lgs. 196/03 e GDPR - Reg.UE. 2016/679).
Show more
HTML:
Mavriq, parte di Moltiply Group, è la tech company a cui appartengono alcuni tra i più importanti brand di comparazione ed intermediazione online in Italia (MutuiOnline.it, Segugio.it, SOStariffe.it, Trovaprezzi.it, Switcho e molti altri) e all’estero (LeLynx.fr, Rastreator, Pricewise, Verivox). I servizi offerti dai brand di Mavriq aiutano con trasparenza i consumatori a trovare ciò di cui hanno bisogno, al miglior prezzo. Siamo un team di circa 1.000 “smart disruptors” distribuiti in Europa, America Latina ed Asia.

Il successo di Mavriq è legato al successo dei nostri team. Per questo, siamo oggi alla ricerca di un nuovo o una nuova team member con cui continuare a scrivere la nostra storia nel mondo della comparazione ed intermediazione online a livello internazionale.

Posizione:

Il ruolo

Per supportare la crescita dei progetti di Machine Learning per i brand Segugio.it, PrestitiOnline e altri, siamo alla ricerca di un-a Junior Data Scientist che, riportando alla risorsa Senior del team, supporterà lo sviluppo di algoritmi avanzati per l’ottimizzazione dei nostri processi di acquisizione e di gestione dei clienti.

Location

La tua sede di lavoro sarà in Via Desenzano 2 a Milano (MM1 Gambara). Lavoriamo in modalità ibrida: almeno 2 giorni in ufficio e fino a 3 giorni in smart working, con flessibilità in ingresso e in uscita. I due giorni in ufficio sono un momento per i nostri team di aggregazione e condivisione (di idee, pause pranzo, pause caffè, ecc.), e ci permettono di continuare ad alimentare la nostra Cultura Mavriq.

Come lavoriamo e cosa farai

Il team di Data Scientist, inserito all'interno della Funzione Marketing, si occupa di ideare, implementare e mantenere diversi modelli machine learning a supporto del business.

Nello specifico, ti occuperai di:

  • Realizzare progetti complessi di data analisi, con la responsabilità sull’intero ciclo di vita di un “data product”, dall’estrazione e trasformazione del dato fino alla realizzazione e alla messa in produzione dei modelli di machine learning.
  • Comunicare intuizioni e risultati ricavati dai dati in modo efficace e facilitandone la comprensione ai non addetti ai lavori.
  • Interagire con analisti ed esperti di business per identificare opportunità innovative.
  • Collaborare nella creazione di processi data-driven, definendo best-practice per la raccolta e l’uso dei dati.

Requisiti:

Di cosa avrai bisogno per il ruolo

  • Breve esperienza pregressa in ambito Data Science, specialmente in Machine Learning. Oppure una forte motivazione a costruire il tuo percorso in Data Science.
  • Buona conoscenza pratica di statistica e machine learning,
  • Competenza e abilità nell’uso Python e delle sue librerie per Data Science e Machine Learning (Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, ...)
  • Competenza nell’uso di database relazionali (MySQL, SqlServer, ...),
  • Familiarità con l’ambiente Linux,
  • Approccio data-driven alla risoluzione dei problemi,
  • Capacità di lavorare autonomamente e per obiettivi, bilanciando in maniera efficiente richieste e scadenze,
  • Capacità di interagire e comunicare efficacemente con interlocutori con profili diversi (manager, business analyst, sviluppatori, ...),
  • Comprensione dei principali concetti MLOps come deployment e monitoraggio dei modelli,
  • Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (B2-C1) e italiana (C1).

Cosa troverai da noi

  • Ambiente di lavoro giovane, dinamico e informale, flessibilità di orario, smartworking, formazione continua e partecipazione a eventi e conferenze.
  • Sede spaziosa, open space, con diverse sale break e dotata di ciò di cui avrai bisogno per lavorare.
  • Pacchetto di benefit, come assicurazione sanitaria di base (prevista da CCNL), buoni pasto e welfare.

Non vediamo l’ora di conoscerti!

Altre informazioni:

Puoi scoprire di più su di noi a questo video. Leggere le nostre Recensioni su Indeed o Glassdoor e i nostri post su LinkedIn. Familiarizzare con i nostri principi guida qui.

La ricerca è rivolta ad ambo i sessi (ai sensi delle Leggi n. 903/77 e n. 125/91).

Si richiede esplicito consenso al trattamento dei dati personali (ex D.Lgs. 196/03 e GDPR - Reg.UE. 2016/679).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world’s leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our dynamic Data Science team. Our mission is to drive innovation and leverage machine learning and data-driven solutions to solve strategic business challenges. You will work across various domains, including product, sales, marketing, and operations, impacting business outcomes at scale. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, enjoys solving complex problems, and is passionate about learning and leveraging data science to create real-world impact.




A typical day

Develop predictive models, advanced analytics solutions, and visualization tools for internal teams and end customers. Initial projects may include: scoring models for sales and customer service, recommendation systems, automation of repetitive tasks to improve efficiency.
Conduct complex analyses for business stakeholders, translating insights into actionable recommendations.
Own the feedback loop for testing and improving machine learning models.
Design, propose, and measure A/B tests for product features, ensuring alignment with business goals.
Identify data-driven opportunities to enhance different stages of the customer journey.
Collaborate with data engineering and infrastructure teams to develop scalable, end-to-end solutions.
Serve as a technical representative when engaging with external stakeholders.
Recommend and implement new technologies, processes, and systems to optimize efficiencies and business performance.
Maintain awareness of emerging trends in data science, machine learning, and technology.
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code.
Produce detailed technical documentation and presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.




What you need to succeed

BSc/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.
Around 4 - 5 years of experience as a Data Scientist
Strong communication skills to translate technical analysis into business insights.
Extensive experience with Python and data visualization frameworks (e.g., Plotly, Seaborn, Matplotlib).
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data modeling and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, etc.).
Experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment processes.
Solid understanding of clean code principles and version control (Git).
Knowledge of Docker and containerization technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
Nice to have: Experience in designing and measuring A/B tests.
Nice to have: Knowledge of Large Language Models (LLMs) and their applications.
Nice to have: Knowledge of best practices around service-oriented architectures or microservices.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let’s move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure…




💰 Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
⏰ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it’s up to you!
🎁 Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
📚 Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500€ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
🛒 Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
🏝 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
🍏 Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the Project:

Our partner is revolutionizing retail with their dynamic pricing B2B SaaS platform, leading the charge in automating and optimizing pricing strategies with AI-driven insights. Their comprehensive solution, embraced by retailers and brands across over 40 markets, delivers actionable pricing recommendations that drive business growth and profitability. Since 2018, they've been empowering a wide range of industries, including consumer electronics, beauty, and apparel, to seamlessly integrate pricing strategies across online and offline channels.




Required skills:

- A Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Applied Mathematics or a related field, demonstrating a strong foundation in analytical thinking.




4+ years of professional experience in:

‍

- End-to-end machine learning lifecycle (design, development, deployment, and monitoring).

- Advanced Python development, including OOP, writing production-grade code, testing, and optimization.

- Data mining, statistical analysis, and effective data visualization techniques.

- Deep familiarity with modern ML/DL methods and frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, XGBoost, scikit-learn, statsmodels).

- Strong analytical skills combined with practical experience interpreting model outputs to drive business decisions.

‍

Nice-to-Haves:

‍

- Practical knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale data systems like Hadoop or Spark.

- Familiarity with MLOps tools and practices (CI/CD, model monitoring, data version control).

- Experience in reinforcement learning and Monte-Carlo methods.

- A solid grasp of microeconomic principles, including supply and demand dynamics, price elasticity, as well as econometrics.

- Experience with cloud services and platforms, preferably AWS.




Scope of work:

As a Data Scientist, you’ll play a critical role in shaping and enhancing our AI-driven pricing platform.




Specifically, you will:

‍

- Develop and Optimize Advanced ML Models: Build, improve, and deploy machine learning and statistical models for forecasting demand, analyzing price elasticities, and recommending optimal pricing strategies.

‍

- Lead End-to-End Data Science Projects: Own your projects fully, from conceptualization and experimentation through production deployment, monitoring, and iterative improvement.

‍

- Innovate with Generative and Predictive AI Solutions: Leverage state-of-the-art generative and predictive modeling techniques to automate complex pricing scenarios and adapt to rapidly changing market dynamics

Title: DATA SCIENTIST - BUSINESS ANALYTICS
Description:
NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 139.000 profesionales, tan diverso cómo diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad; telecomunicaciones, entidades financieras, industria, utilities, energía, administración pública y sanidad.




¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.




NTT DATA busca un/a apasionado/a Senior Data Scientist para conectar las necesidades comerciales con motores analíticos de vanguardia, estableciendo un puente entre las áreas de negocio y nuestro equipo de científicos de datos. Buscamos un/a experto/a en análisis de datos e inteligencia artificial para impulsar estrategias comerciales basadas en datos. Si tienes experiencia en ciencia de datos aplicada a áreas como Manufacturing, Industria, Utilities, Marketing o Logística, ¡queremos que te unas a nuestro equipo innovador!




Requisitos




Formación académica:

Licenciatura o máster en Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Economía o Física. Valorable formación complementaria en Inteligencia Artificial, Analítica, Big Data u otros campos similares.




Experiencia:




Entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia en Analytics Avanzado y Data Science relacionado con áreas como Manufacturing, Industria, Utilities, Marketing o Logística.




Responsabilidades




Participar en el desarrollo end to end de proyectos basados en datos: conceptualización, análisis, procesado, modelado, validación, despliegue, etc.
Actuar como enlace entre las necesidades de los usuarios de negocio y el diseño de modelos analíticos innovadores que transformen la industria.
Colaborar con las áreas tecnológicas para analizar fuentes de información y descubrir oportunidades valiosas.
Desarrollar análisis empresariales impactantes que conduzcan a conclusiones revolucionarias.
Aplicar técnicas de última generación en Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, entre otras, para resolver problemas reales.
Trabajar de manera autónoma diseñando y liderando las soluciones.
Construir relaciones multidisciplinarias entre negocio y tecnología, fomentando el crecimiento y la colaboración.




Habilidades




Requeridas:




Estadística descriptiva y exploratoria aplicada a la detección de patrones y tendencias en datos.
Dominio avanzado de Python.
Conocimientos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales para aprovechar al máximo la información.
Técnicas avanzadas de Machine Learning y Analytics, utilizando soluciones de inteligencia artificial de vanguardia.
Visualización y comunicación con clientes, utilizando herramientas como PowerBI, Tableau, Dash, Streamlit, etc.
Conocimiento de soluciones Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)




Valorable:




Servicios de nube de AWS (Sagemaker, EC2, S3, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambdas, Step Functions, CloudWatch, etc.).
Tecnologías Big Data: Spark, Hadoop, Impala, etc.
Text Analytics, Deep Learning, Process Mining para extraer el máximo valor de los datos.
Experiencia en proyectos dentro del sector Utilities.
Experiencia en desarrollo con metodología Agile.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Te ofrecemos la incorporación a una compañía que marca la diferencia estando cerca de clientes, superando las expectativas, gestionando proactivamente nuestros proyectos y clientes y centrándonos en la calidad a través de la selección de profesionales con la mentalidad adecuada para asegurar nuestro crecimiento.




Más allá del alcance de tu responsabilidad directa, formarás parte de la práctica de Business Consulting en la que te encontrarás con un equipo dinámico, joven, entusiasta y siempre orientado hacia el éxito, a partir de una fuerte cultura emprendedora pero, sobre todo, de un gran ambiente de trabajo, en el que formamos parte de un proyecto compartido, y en el cada persona es única.

Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.




¡NTT DATA es tu sitio! Porque hemos obtenido en España, por 10º año consecutivo, la certificación Top Employer, que nos reconoce como una de las mejores empresas en las que trabajar, gracias a nuestro compromiso por el talento. Únete a un equipo que apuesta por el desarrollo integral de sus profesionales, elige el modelo de trabajo que mejor se adapte a ti, y colabora en un entorno diverso, donde cada persona tiene su propia singularidad.




#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique#TheDigitalLovers #TopEmployer

Show more

Entre 2 y 4 años de experiencia en Analytics Avanzado y Data Science relacionado con áreas como Manufacturing, Industria, Utilities, Marketing o Logística.


Responsabilidades


  • Participar en el desarrollo end to end de proyectos basados en datos: conceptualización, análisis, procesado, modelado, validación, despliegue, etc.
  • Actuar como enlace entre las necesidades de los usuarios de negocio y el diseño de modelos analíticos innovadores que transformen la industria.
  • Colaborar con las áreas tecnológicas para analizar fuentes de información y descubrir oportunidades valiosas.
  • Desarrollar análisis empresariales impactantes que conduzcan a conclusiones revolucionarias.
  • Aplicar técnicas de última generación en Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, entre otras, para resolver problemas reales.
  • Trabajar de manera autónoma diseñando y liderando las soluciones.
  • Construir relaciones multidisciplinarias entre negocio y tecnología, fomentando el crecimiento y la colaboración.


Habilidades


Requeridas:


  • Estadística descriptiva y exploratoria aplicada a la detección de patrones y tendencias en datos.
  • Dominio avanzado de Python.
  • Conocimientos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales para aprovechar al máximo la información.
  • Técnicas avanzadas de Machine Learning y Analytics, utilizando soluciones de inteligencia artificial de vanguardia.
  • Visualización y comunicación con clientes, utilizando herramientas como PowerBI, Tableau, Dash, Streamlit, etc.
  • Conocimiento de soluciones Cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP)


Valorable:


  • Servicios de nube de AWS (Sagemaker, EC2, S3, RDS, DynamoDB, Lambdas, Step Functions, CloudWatch, etc.).
  • Tecnologías Big Data: Spark, Hadoop, Impala, etc.
  • Text Analytics, Deep Learning, Process Mining para extraer el máximo valor de los datos.
  • Experiencia en proyectos dentro del sector Utilities.
  • Experiencia en desarrollo con metodología Agile.


¿Qué te ofrecemos?


Te ofrecemos la incorporación a una compañía que marca la diferencia estando cerca de clientes, superando las expectativas, gestionando proactivamente nuestros proyectos y clientes y centrándonos en la calidad a través de la selección de profesionales con la mentalidad adecuada para asegurar nuestro crecimiento.


Más allá del alcance de tu responsabilidad directa, formarás parte de la práctica de Business Consulting en la que te encontrarás con un equipo dinámico, joven, entusiasta y siempre orientado hacia el éxito, a partir de una fuerte cultura emprendedora pero, sobre todo, de un gran ambiente de trabajo, en el que formamos parte de un proyecto compartido, y en el cada persona es única.

Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.


¡NTT DATA es tu sitio! Porque hemos obtenido en España, por 10º año consecutivo, la certificación Top Employer, que nos reconoce como una de las mejores empresas en las que trabajar, gracias a nuestro compromiso por el talento. Únete a un equipo que apuesta por el desarrollo integral de sus profesionales, elige el modelo de trabajo que mejor se adapte a ti, y colabora en un entorno diverso, donde cada persona tiene su propia singularidad.


#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique#TheDigitalLovers #TopEmployer

Title: Machine Learning Engineer | Mid-Senior | Threat Intelligence
HTML:
Our Threat Intelligence team is dedicated to providing accurate and timely information on potential threats to our products. Our team of skilled professionals from various fields, including Data Science, Malware Research, Development, and Privacy, are focused on achieving a common goal by utilizing feeds, heuristics, algorithms, and machine learning.

Main Responsibilities

  • Design & implement machine learning models in production;
  • Create infrastructure for data ingestion, cleaning, and transformation;
  • Ensure scalability, reliability, and performance of deployed models & infrastructure;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate machine learning solutions into products and services;
  • Document model development processes, experiments, and results for future reference and reproducibility




Core Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field or equivalent work experience;
  • 2+ years of experience working as Machine Learning Engineer;
  • Proven experience in Data Engineering, Software Development, DevOps, Machine Learning or a related field;
  • Strong understanding and proficiency in Python programming language;
  • Proven track record of deploying machine learning models in production environments with containerization and orchestration using Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, etc.;
  • Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, HuggingFace, etc.;
  • Experience with AWS services - RDS, Lambda, EC2, S3, EMR, SageMaker, etc.;
  • Experience with version control systems and CI/CD pipelines;
  • Experience developing scalable APIs;
  • Familiarity with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, etc.;
  • Good understanding of Computer Science fundamentals (algorithms, data structures, distributed computing, operating systems);
  • Understanding of Machine Learning fundamentals;
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex problems, troubleshoot issues, and develop practical solutions;
  • Ability to communicate problems and solutions with people from different technical backgrounds;
  • Attention to detail, and ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English




Salary Range

  • Gross Salary 3400-6700 EUR/Month




About Us
Nord Security is a global leader in internet privacy and security solutions and Lithuania’s second tech unicorn. Established in 2012, Nord Security now has more than 1400 employees and serves millions of users worldwide. Our team has a global mission to shape a more secure and peaceful online future for people everywhere. With that in mind, we built several advanced cybersecurity solutions: NordVPN, NordLayer, NordLocker, NordPass, NordProtect, NordStellar, and Saily.
NordVPN is the world’s most advanced VPN service provider, used by millions of internet users worldwide. NordVPN provides double VPN encryption and Onion Over VPN and guarantees privacy with zero tracking. One of the key features of the product is Threat Protection, which blocks malicious websites, malware, trackers, and ads. NordVPN is very user friendly, offers one of the best prices on the market, and has over 5,000 servers in 59 countries worldwide.

And we’re always looking to expand our team of:


  • Future shapers
  • Restless achievers
  • Self-movers
  • Honest communicators
  • Team players




What We Offer

  • Access to Nord Security products. We build solutions used by millions of users worldwide, and you’ll get to experience our products firsthand;
  • Professional growth. Internal and external events, online training, conferences, books - everything you need to reach full potential;
  • Health benefits. Private health insurance, online and on-site workouts, consultations to feel and be your best;
  • Mental wellbeing. Access to mental health tools like Calm, Headspace, and Mindletic. Options for therapy to keep your emotional wellbeing in check;
  • Team spirit. Team buildings and parties with games, shows, tastings, food coupons, gifts, and it’s on us;
  • More free time. Stay with us and additional vacation days will be added to your calendar;
  • Additional paid leave. Additional days are covered by us in cases of illness or special occasions;
  • Flexibility. Flexible working time arrangement




Kindly refer to our Privacy Notice for Recruitment Candidates for comprehensive information regarding our data handling procedures throughout recruitment processes: https://bit.ly/3urJdOL

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation?

Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.




Join Reply!




WHO WE ARE

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.




WHAT WE OFFER

A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.




WE'LL TOTALLY LOVE YOU IF YOU HAVE…

Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.




WHAT ARE THE NEXT STEPS

The first step of our recruiting process will be a face to face interview with the HR team and then the meetings with the technical referents.




Feel interested?




Reply is committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive work environment by valuing the uniqueness of people regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, religion, nationality or disabilities as protected by Italian Law (L.68/99).

Furthermore, Reply is committed to ensuring a fair and accessible selection process: to help you during the recruitment process, please let us know of any kind of support you may need.
